meanings.definition: Limitations that restrict or control something.
meanings.sent1: The strict constraints of the school dress code must be followed.
meanings.sent2: Financial constraints prevented them from taking a vacation this year.
meanings.sent3: The constraints of only being able to eat vegetables made the rabbit a very healthy bunny.
meanings.sent4: The constraints of time felt like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The constraints of the small room made it feel cozy and intimate.

meanings.definition: A restriction or limitation imposed on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The constraints of the law must be respected by all citizens.
meanings.sent2: The budget constraints forced the company to make difficult decisions.
meanings.sent3: The constraints of having to wear a tie to work every day made him feel like a businessman.
meanings.sent4: The constraints of society's expectations weighed heavily on her.
meanings.sent5: The constraints of the traffic jam made him late for the meeting.
